name: uniexg

stmt.origin: vtoclg(hs0, c0, c1, wcel(cuni(c0), universe), wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), universe))
stmt.pretty: vtoclg(hs0, c0, c1, ⋃ c0 ∈ 𝕌, ⋃ hs0 ∈ 𝕌)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cuni(c0), universe))
-| wi(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wb(wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), universe), wcel(cuni(c0), universe)))
-| wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), universe)
-| diffsc(hs0, c0)
-| diffsw(hs0, wcel(cuni(c0), universe))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cuni(c0), universe))
-| wi(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wb(wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), universe), wcel(cuni(c0), universe)))
-| wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), universe)
-| diffsc(hs0, c0)
-| diffsw(hs0, wcel(cuni(c0), universe))

stmt.pretty: eleq1d(⋃ hs0, universe, ⋃ c0, hs0 = c0)

body.origin:
|- wi(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wb(wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), universe), wcel(cuni(c0), universe)))
-| wi(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cuni(cv(hs0)), cuni(c0)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cuni(c0), universe))
-| wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), universe)
-| diffsc(hs0, c0)
-| diffsw(hs0, wcel(cuni(c0), universe))
-| wi(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cuni(cv(hs0)), cuni(c0)))

|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cuni(c0), universe))
-| wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), universe)
-| diffsc(hs0, c0)
-| diffsw(hs0, wcel(cuni(c0), universe))

|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cuni(c0), universe))
-| diffsc(hs0, c0)
-| diffsw(hs0, wcel(cuni(c0), universe))

|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cuni(c0), universe))
-| diffsw(hs0, wcel(cuni(c0), universe))

comment: The ZF Axiom of Union in class notation, in the form of a theorem instead of an inference. We use the antecedent ` A e. V ` instead of ` A e. _V ` to make the theorem more general and thus shorten some proofs; obviously the universal class constant ` _V ` is one possible substitution for class variable ` V ` . (Contributed by NM, 25-Nov-1994.)
